head.title: U.S. Sues Five Jackson Hewitt Tax Franchise Firms

hedline.hl1: U.S. Sues Five Jackson Hewitt Tax Franchise Firms

block.p: Federal investigators have sued five companies that operate Jackson Hewitt Tax Services Inc. franchises, accusing them of defrauding the United States Treasury out of more than $70 million.

The Department of Justice said the companies allegedly operate more than 125 Jackson Hewitt retail tax preparation stores in the Atlanta, Chicago, Detroit and Raleigh-Durham, N.C., areas. The lawsuits also target 24 people who manage or work at the franchises, the department said.
Federal investigators have sued five companies that operate Jackson Hewitt Tax Services Inc. franchises, accusing them of defrauding the United States Treasury out of more than $70 million.

The Department of Justice said the companies allegedly operate more than 125 Jackson Hewitt retail tax preparation stores in the Atlanta, Chicago, Detroit and Raleigh-Durham, N.C., areas. The lawsuits also target 24 people who manage or work at the franchises, the department said.
"Preparing federal income tax returns based on falsehoods and fabrications is a serious violation of the law," Assistant Attorney General Eileen O'Connor said in a statement.

Parsippany, N.J.-based Jackson Hewitt is the second-largest U.S. tax preparer. It did not immediately return a call seeking comment. The company's shares fell $2.12, or 6.5 percent, to $30.28 in afternoon trading.
